block.p: Christina Hallowell Ohly, the daughter of Kathleen Hammer of New York and Frederick Ohly of McLean, Va., was married yesterday to Alexander Donnell Evans, the son of Elizabeth Fitzsimmons of Indianapolis and David Evans of Imperial Beach, Calif. The Rev. Beverly Morrison Boke performed the ceremony at the North Chapel Universalist Church in Woodstock, Vt.

Mrs. Evans, 31, will continue to use her maiden name professionally. She is an entrepreneur in residence in the Boston office of Idealab, a company that finances and supports fledgling Internet companies. She graduated from Williams College. Her father is the associate general counsel for Amtrak in Washington. Her mother is an executive producer for Oxygen Media, a cable television and Internet company in New York that is geared toward women. She is the stepdaughter of Christine Ohly and of G. Arthur Seelbinder.

Christina Hallowell Ohly, the daughter of Kathleen Hammer of New York and Frederick Ohly of McLean, Va., was married yesterday to Alexander Donnell Evans, the son of Elizabeth Fitzsimmons of Indianapolis and David Evans of Imperial Beach, Calif. The Rev. Beverly Morrison Boke performed the ceremony at the North Chapel Universalist Church in Woodstock, Vt.

Mrs. Evans, 31, will continue to use her maiden name professionally. She is an entrepreneur in residence in the Boston office of Idealab, a company that finances and supports fledgling Internet companies. She graduated from Williams College. Her father is the associate general counsel for Amtrak in Washington. Her mother is an executive producer for Oxygen Media, a cable television and Internet company in New York that is geared toward women. She is the stepdaughter of Christine Ohly and of G. Arthur Seelbinder.

Mr. Evans, 32, is a partner in Providence Equity Partners, a venture capital concern in Providence that specializes in telecommunications investments. He graduated cum laude from Princeton University and received an M.B.A. from Stanford. His father is a real estate developer in Imperial Beach. The bridegroom is the stepson of Sue Evans and Robert Fitzsimmons.
